Returns: whether the app is currently considered inactive
Parameters: @B_java#lang#String_E@
String: The package name of the app to query
isAppInactive(java.lang.String).Description: Returns whether the specified app is currently considered inactive. This will be true if the app hasn't been used directly or indirectly for a period of time defined by the system. This could be of the order of several hours or days.

Returns: the current standby bucket of the calling app. One of STANDBY_BUCKET_* constants. Value is android.app.usage.UsageStatsManager.STANDBY_BUCKET_EXEMPTED, @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE_E@, @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_WORKING_SET_E@, @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_FREQUENT_E@, @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_RARE_E@, or android.app.usage.UsageStatsManager.STANDBY_BUCKET_NEVER
getAppStandbyBucket().Description: Returns the current standby bucket of the calling app. The system determines the standby state of the app based on app usage patterns. Standby buckets determine how much an app will be restricted from running background tasks such as jobs and alarms. Restrictions increase progressively from @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE_E@ to @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_RARE_E@, with @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE_E@ being the least restrictive. The battery level of the device might also affect the restrictions. Apps in buckets ≤ @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_ACTIVE_E@ have no standby restrictions imposed. Apps in buckets > @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#STANDBY_BUCKET_FREQUENT_E@ may have network access restricted when running in the background. The standby state of an app can change at any time either due to a user interaction or a system interaction or some algorithm determining that the app can be restricted for a period of time before the user has a need for it. You can also query the recent history of standby bucket changes by calling @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#queryEventsForSelf_E@ and searching for @B_android#app#usage#UsageEvents#Event#STANDBY_BUCKET_CHANGED_E@.

ClassDesc: Provides access to device usage history and statistics. Usage data is aggregated into time intervals: days, weeks, months, and years. When requesting usage data since a particular time, the request might look something like this: @B_android#provider#Settings#ACTION_USAGE_ACCESS_SETTINGS_E@. Methods which only return the information for the calling package do not require this permission. E.g. @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#getAppStandbyBucket_E@ and @B_android#app#usage#UsageStatsManager#queryEventsForSelf_E@.
